channel.title: JFileChooser
channel.description:
Is it possible to show a fake directory on a [tt]JFileChooser[/tt]? like make it show files in an array instead of files on your computer.
if you have a String array : [tt]String[] = {"file1.txt", "file2.txt", "directory1", "directory1/file1.txt"};[/tt]
the [tt]JFileChooser[/tt] would ask you to select one of those files instead of files on your compyter

item.title: JFileChooser
item.dc:creator: @nueb35 Nueb35
item.description:
@nueb35 wrote:

Hmm didn’t think of that, ill try that.

Read full topic

item.title: JFileChooser
item.dc:creator: @Mopman Mopman
item.description:
@Mopman wrote:

Uhm, why is everyone talking about making directories.

Derive a new class, FTPFileChooser or whatnot, from the Filechooser, and then override the method(s) that interface(s) with the filesystem and change them to implement FTP instead.

Is there some reason you can’t do this with classes in the Java API? Because that would be stupid.

Read full topic

item.title: JFileChooser
item.dc:creator: @nueb35 Nueb35
item.description:
@nueb35 wrote:

no the files need no content since the content will be streamed form a server after the file is selected, just need the choosing of the file names, then after it gets the file name the class will contact a server with it.

@Tree : i looked there

Read full topic

item.title: JFileChooser
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“nueb35, post:7, topic:201502”]:\ but the fake dir might have thousands of files and folders :S

@Yz85Racer : Lets say you have an FTP folder full of files is it posible to make a JFileChooser which lets you choose a file form there? that only instead of an FTP you have a String[][/quote]
I am still not following you. Do you mean something like

File temp = new File("name/"); String[][] stOOf = {{ "file contents 1", "file contents 2" }, { "file name 1", "file name 2"}}; for(int i = 0; i < st00f[1].length; i++) { BufferedWriter out = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(stOOf[1][i])); out.write(stOOf[i][0]); out.flush(); }

And then just chose?

Read full topic

item.description:
@nueb35 wrote:

:\ but the fake dir might have thousands of files and folders :S

@Yz85Racer : Lets say you have an FTP folder full of files is it posible to make a JFileChooser which lets you choose a file form there? that only instead of an FTP you have a String[]

item.title: JFileChooser
item.dc:creator: @TeleNubby TeleNubby
item.description:
@TeleNubby wrote:

Something like:

File temp = new File("fakedir/").mkdir();
new JFileChooser();
temp.delete();

Like io9 mentioned. But that’d be as close as you can get without writing up your own ‘file chooser.’

Read full topic
